Description: Pottery globular stirrup jar, Furumark Shape 173. Surface blackened. Painted with brown bands with a stylised foliate band (FM 64) in shoulder zone.
Curator's comments: NAA analysis did not suggest a likely place of manufacture. See Table 1: Leonard, A., Hughes, M., Middleton, A., Schofield, L. (1993). The Making of Aegean Stirrup Jars: Technique, Tradition, and Trade. BSA 88: 105-123 no. 259a, p. 259-260 Karetsou, A. & Andreadaki-Vlasaki, M. (2000). Kriti-Aigyptos: Politismikoi desmoi trion chilietion. Katalogos. p.17, pl. 17.3 Petrie, W.M.F. (1891). Illahun, Kahun and Gurob, 1889-90.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A984)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
